taxes.local_income_tax_range: N/A - Florida has no income tax
taxes.assessment_appeal_process: File petition with value adjustment board (VAB) by September 18 (deadline may vary by county). Can file for informal hearing or formal hearing.
taxes.assessment_appeal_deadline: Within 25 days of TRIM notice (typically mid-September)
taxes.tax_incentives: Florida 529 Savings Plan (no state tax deduction since no income tax, but federal benefits), Homestead Exemption up to $50K, Save Our Homes cap (3% annual increase limit)
taxes.tax_structure: No state income tax; moderate sales tax; property taxes vary by county. Save Our Homes amendment caps assessment increases at 3% annually for homesteaded properties.

housing.housing_market_trends: Rising rapidly - strong population growth from retirees and remote workers. Coastal areas very expensive, inland more affordable. Insurance costs rising due to hurricane risk.
housing.first_time_homebuyer_program: Florida Housing Finance Corporation - offers down payment assistance and competitive rates through Florida Homebuyer Opportunity Program

employment.major_industries: Tourism, Aerospace, Agriculture, Healthcare, Real Estate, International Trade

banking.minor_banking_rules: Minors can open accounts with parent/guardian co-signer. Florida Uniform Transfers to Minors Act (UTMA) accounts available.

consumer_protection.consumer_protection_agency: Florida Attorney General - Consumer Protection Division

local_examples.utility_providers: Florida Power & Light (FPL), Duke Energy, Tampa Electric, TECO
local_examples.healthcare_market: Large marketplace with many insurers; major hospital systems in urban areas; growing telemedicine adoption

notes: Florida has no state income tax, making it attractive for retirees and high earners. However, property taxes and insurance costs (especially homeowners insurance due to hurricane risk) can be high. Save Our Homes amendment caps annual assessment increases at 3% for primary residences, creating significant tax disparities between long-time residents and new buyers. State experiencing rapid population growth, particularly from New York, California, and Illinois residents seeking lower taxes. Tourism is massive industry (Disney World, beaches, cruise ports). Minimum wage gradually increasing to $15/hour by 2026. Public university system relatively affordable compared to other states. Hurricane insurance costs have risen dramatically, with some insurers leaving the market.
